content: The "Contracting and Tax Accountability Act of 2008" prohibits the awarding of government contracts or grants to individuals or companies with seriously delinquent Federal tax debts. Section 3720B of title 31, United States Code, now includes provisions for debarment from federal contracts for individuals with seriously delinquent tax debts. Federal agencies must require bidders to certify their tax debt status and authorize the disclosure of this information to the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary of the Treasury can disclose information to agencies about individuals with seriously delinquent tax debts. A standard form for certification will be provided to all Federal agencies. The Federal Acquisition Regulation will be revised within 270 days to include these requirements. The term 'contract' excludes agreements related to disaster relief. The Secretary of the Treasury can disclose information to agencies about individuals with seriously delinquent tax debts, including partnerships and corporations with such debts. This information will be provided to Federal agencies through a standard certification form. The Federal Acquisition Regulation will be updated to include these requirements within 270 days, excluding contracts related to disaster relief. The term 'seriously delinquent tax debt' refers to an outstanding debt under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with a notice of lien filed in public records. It excludes debts being paid timely under an agreement or those undergoing a collection due process hearing. The term 'seriously delinquent tax debt' excludes debts being paid timely under an agreement or those undergoing a collection due process hearing. Relief under section 6015 of the Internal Revenue Code is requested or pending. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION ON AWARDING OF GRANTS TO DELINQUENT FEDERAL DEBTORS. The head of any Executive agency offering grants over a certain threshold must ensure applicants do not have a seriously delinquent tax debt. A standard form for certification and authorization will be provided to all agencies. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must revise regulations within 270 days to include the requirements of this section. Definitions state that a "person" includes individuals, partnerships, and corporations, with certain rules for partnerships with seriously delinquent tax debts. The term "seriously delinquent tax debt" applies to individuals, partnerships, and corporations with specific rules for corporations with officers or shareholders who hold a significant amount of corporate stock and have seriously delinquent tax debts. The term "executive agency" is defined in accordance with the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The term "seriously delinquent tax debt" refers to outstanding debts under the Internal Revenue Code for which a notice of lien has been filed in public records. Exceptions include debts being paid timely under agreements or debts with pending collection due process hearings or relief requests. The House of Representatives passed the bill on April 14, 2008.
